etymology.description: 艸(艸) (cǎo, 'grass') + 日(日) (rì, 'sun') = sun setting behind grass -> dusk, a time of silence
etymology.interpretation: This character combines 艸(艸) (cǎo, 'grass') and 日(日) (rì, 'sun'), depicting the image of the sun setting behind the grass, symbolizing dusk, a time associated with silence. It evolved to represent the concept of 'none' or 'not' as dusk signifies the end of the day.

examples.chinese: 莫轻易承诺(莫輕易承諾)。
面对挑战(面對挑戰)，莫失信心(莫失信心)。
examples.english: When facing challenges, never lose confidence.

examples.chinese: 这股气势(這股氣勢)，莫人能敌(莫人能敵)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè gǔ qìshì, mò rén néng dí.
